prior_works.title: Exact Matrix Completion via Convex Optimization
prior_works.role: Foundational low-rank matrix completion and nuclear-norm regularization; baseline guarantees and identifiability notions.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The proposed estimator builds on the nuclear-norm–regularized low-rank recovery framework introduced by Candès and Recht, using it as the optimization backbone while extending guarantees to informative missingness.

prior_works.title: Noisy matrix completion with general sampling distribution
prior_works.role: Theory for matrix completion under non-uniform sampling and near-optimal rates.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Their rate claims benchmark against results like Klopp’s for general sampling, adapting analysis to show near-optimal convergence despite informative (MNAR) missingness.

prior_works.title: 1-bit matrix completion: Probabilistic methods and error bounds
prior_works.authors: Mark A. Davenport, Yaniv Plan, Ewout van den Berg, Marco F. Wootters
prior_works.role: Signal-dependent observation model via a (logistic/probit) link; identifiability up to scale/shift.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s separable observation probability depending on the latent entry and recovery up to scaling/shift echo 1-bit MC’s GLM perspective, motivating a likelihood-based treatment of value-dependent observations.

prior_works.title: Recommendations as Treatments: Debiasing Learning and Evaluation with Propensity Scores
prior_works.authors: Tobias Schnabel, Adith Swaminathan, Ashudeep Singh, Navin Chandak, Thorsten Joachims
prior_works.role: MNAR in recommender systems and propensity-based debiasing.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: By highlighting selection bias from exposure-driven missingness and the limits of naive MC, this work motivates methods that remain valid under MNAR, which the proposed pairwise pseudo-likelihood aims to address without observing propensities.

prior_works.title: An overview of composite likelihood methods
prior_works.authors: Cristiano Varin, Nancy Reid, David Firth
prior_works.role: Composite/pairwise likelihood framework and asymptotic theory.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The core methodological device—pairwise pseudo-likelihood—directly draws on composite likelihood principles to construct consistent, tractable estimators when the full data likelihood is intractable or misspecified.

prior_works.title: Nonparametric Analysis of a Generalized Regression Model: Maximum Rank Correlation Estimation
prior_works.role: Pairwise comparison–based estimation under unknown monotone link; identification up to scale.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The use of pairwise comparisons to sidestep an unknown link in Han’s MRC informs the paper’s strategy of leveraging pairwise structure to cancel nuisance components and recover the low-rank signal up to shift/scale.

prior_works.title: Regression Models and Life-Tables
prior_works.role: Partial likelihood to eliminate infinite-dimensional nuisance (baseline hazard).
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s identifiability via pairwise/conditional likelihood is conceptually aligned with Cox’s partial likelihood, which removes nuisance structure to enable consistent estimation of target parameters.

synthesis_narrative:
The paper’s core innovation—recovering a low-rank matrix under informative missingness via a regularized pairwise pseudo-likelihood—sits at the intersection of low-rank recovery, MNAR modeling, and composite likelihood. Foundationally, Candès and Recht established nuclear-norm regularization as the canonical tool for low-rank matrix recovery, a scaffold the authors retain while extending guarantees to nonignorable observation processes. Klopp’s analysis under general sampling distributions provides the benchmark rates and techniques (e.g., restricted strong convexity arguments) against which the new estimator’s near-optimal convergence is calibrated.
A central conceptual step is to allow observation probabilities to depend on the latent entry itself, akin to the GLM-based view in 1-bit matrix completion. This connection clarifies the resulting scale/shift non-identifiability and motivates a likelihood-centric approach. Yet, unlike settings with known links or observed propensities, practical MNAR in recommendations (as emphasized by Schnabel et al.) highlights that propensities are typically unknown and outcome-dependent, necessitating methods that mitigate bias without accurate propensity models.
Here, composite likelihood—specifically pairwise pseudo-likelihood—provides the mechanism. Drawing on Varin–Reid–Firth, the authors construct a pairwise objective that remains tractable and statistically valid when the full likelihood is ill-posed. The design echoes Han’s rank-based strategy for unknown monotone links, using pairwise comparisons to cancel nuisance and recover the signal only up to scale/shift, and conceptually parallels Cox’s partial likelihood in eliminating nuisance components. Together, these threads yield a principled estimator that achieves near-optimal rates while attenuating bias from informative missingness.
